words.definition: To abide by something, like a rule, means to obey it.
words.example: If you want to play the game with us, you must be willing to abide by our rules.

words.definition: Conversion is the act of changing something into a different state or form.
words.example: The city discussed the conversion of the parking lot into a skateboard park.

words.definition: To cram things means to put them into a place that can barely contain them.
words.example: He crammed all of his shirts into the top drawer of the dresser.

words.definition: To defer means to arrange for an action to happen at a later time.
words.example: The girl was very sleepy, so she chose to defer her homework until morning.

words.definition: To export something means to send it to another country for sale.
words.example: The country exports a lot of oil to other nations.

words.definition: Fumes are strong-smelling gas or smoke that is often dangerous.
words.example: The exhaust fumes from the cars made it hard to breathe.

words.definition: If something is habitual, it is done as a habit.
words.example: His habitual lateness was starting to annoy his boss.

words.definition: To justify something means to show that it is right or reasonable.
words.example: He tried to justify his behavior by saying he was tired.

words.definition: Output is the amount of something that a person or machine produces.
words.example: The factory's output has increased by ten percent this year.

words.definition: Overpopulation is the state of having too many people in a place.
words.example: Many cities are struggling with the problem of overpopulation.

words.definition: A patent is an official right to be the only person to make or sell an invention.
words.example: He applied for a patent for his new invention.

words.definition: To penalize someone means to punish them for breaking a rule.
words.example: The player was penalized for hitting another player.

words.definition: Petroleum is a liquid that is found under the ground and used to make gas.
words.example: The country has large reserves of petroleum.

words.definition: A prototype is a first or early model of something.
words.example: The company is testing a prototype of its new electric car.

words.definition: A scrap is a small piece of something, like paper or metal.
words.example: She wrote the phone number on a scrap of paper.

words.definition: A sector is a part of a country's economy or society.
words.example: The agricultural sector is very important to the country's economy.

words.definition: To subscribe to something means to pay money to receive it regularly.
words.example: I decided to subscribe to the local newspaper.

words.definition: To subsist means to stay alive when you only have a small amount of food or money.
words.example: The family had to subsist on a very small amount of food.

words.definition: To suspend something means to stop it from happening for a period of time.
words.example: The school suspended the student for three days.

words.definition: A synthesis is the combination of different things to form something new.
words.example: The book is a synthesis of many different ideas.
